eshmun.structures.kripke

Class KripkeState

  • java.lang.Object
    • eshmun.structures.AbstractState
      • eshmun.structures.kripke.KripkeState

  • public class KripkeState
extends AbstractState
    This class represents a Kripke State.

    A KripkeState has in addition to the content of AbstractState a list of labels that it satisfy.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ali Cherri, Kinan Dak Al Bab
    See Also:
    AbstractState

    • Constructor Detail

      • KripkeState

        public KripkeState(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String labels,
                   java.lang.String varName)
        Concrete Constructor for KripkeState.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the state.
        labels - the labels this state satisfies, comma separated.
        varName - the name of the related variable.

      • KripkeState

        public KripkeState(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String labels,
                   java.lang.String varName,
                   boolean isStart,
                   boolean isRetain)
        Concrete Constructor for KripkeState.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the state.
        labels - the labels this state satisfies, comma separated.
        varName - the name of the related variable.
        isStart - if this state is a startState.
        isRetain - if this state is a retainState.

        public java.lang.String getLabelAt(int index)
        Gets a label by index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the required label.
        Returns:
        the label at the given index.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is outside the labels bound.

      • mapProcessToLabel

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> mapProcessToLabel(java.lang.String... processes)
        Returns a mapping between the processes and their respective labels. The labels within each process are sorted alphabetically.
        Parameters:
        processes - the processes participating in this state's structure.
        Returns:
        the required mapping.
